children.subject:
This is kind of pure speculation on my end, and you should get multiple opinions, but I imagine these two scenarios will still look good:

  • One A in a technical course, P/NP all other courses
  • All A's in technical courses, P/NP all other courses

So if you can pull one of these off, it might be worth it. Otherwise maybe just P/NP everything?

history.content: I would wait until the deadline. Each department are still releasing their own policy regarding pnp and I would want to know them before making a decision. Also, I'll have a better idea of what my grades would be like closer to the deadline.

children.subject: Hi OP! I'm in the same boat! I'm going to try my best (despite the internet and quarantine situations) to letter grade all my classes. and if that doesn't work out, I will pnp all my classes during RRR week

history.content:
I’m from China and Chinese government send us to quarantine in a hotel or hospital room in Inner Mongolia for 14 days before we can go home (which I think is the right thing to do), and I've heard that its hard to deliver stuff from outside to us other than the food and stuff they provide(not even bottled water if you follow Chinese news), which I can understand. Idk how good the internet or vpn will be, and no one knows if it will change. 

I think I have four choices: 

1. PNP all classes. Con- I'm doing OK in all of them and want to get some legit A's. 

2. PNP some classes. Con- I can be viewed as playing the system by pnping only classes I did bad on, even if its not my intention

3. Letter grade all classes. Con- I’m not confident to maintain all my techs at the previous level of work.

4. Wait and see until the deadline. Con- I probably can't maintain all my techs during midterm2's so this is essentially same as option 3.

Obviously if I do fine in my quarantine place and can catch up normally after I get home I'll simply pick option 3, but still, just want think ahead.

(Any fellow Chinese citizens on the same boat btw?太难顶了。。)

Thoughts? Thanks!

history.subject: Should I PNP?

history.content: I’m from China and Chinese government send us to quarantine in a hotel or hospital room in Inner Mongolia for 14 days before we can go home and Idk how good the internet or vpn will be, and plus based on the fast changing Chinese policy on quarantine for oversea Chinese citizens maybe the time will get longer. I want to pnp some of my classes but I don’t want to be seen as if I’m playing the system and pnping classes that I did bad on. But I don’t want to keep all classes either because I’ll return to China and there’s a lot of quarantine stuff for returning Chinese citizens, but I don’t want to pnp all classes either because I’m doing ok in all of them. I can also wait and see how my grade come out naturally, but given the current situation I’m not confident to maintain all my techs at the previous level of work. Thoughts? Thanks!
